data.title: Buckeyes Receive Academic All
data.meta_description: Ohio State Spring and At-Large 2021 Academic All-Big Ten honorees COLUMBUS, Ohio – The Big Ten Conference announced the Academic All-Big Ten selections for s...
data.text:
Ohio State Spring and At-Large 2021 Academic All-Big Ten honorees

COLUMBUS, Ohio – The Big Ten Conference announced the Academic All-Big Ten selections for spring and at-large sports Thursday, with 298 recognized from Ohio State. In all, 1,130 student-athletes from across the conference were honored.

This year, a record 527 Buckeyes earned Academic All-Big Ten accolades, as the spring and at-large sport selections join 120 fall sport honorees and 109 from winter sports. The Ohio State programs included in spring and at-large sports are baseball, men’s and women’s fencing, men’s and women’s golf, women’s hockey, men’s and women’s lacrosse, pistol, rifle, women’s rowing, synchronized swimming, men’s and women’s tennis, men’s and women’s outdoor track and field and men’s volleyball

To be eligible for Academic All-Big Ten selection, student-athletes must be on a varsity team, as verified by being on the official squad list as of March 1 for winter sports, who have been enrolled full-time at the institution for a minimum of 12 months and carry a cumulative grade-point average of 3.0 or higher.

Jillian Rizzo from women’s lacrosse, Tess Thompson from women’s rowing and Olivia Schafer from synchronized swimming were recognized as having 4.0 cumulative GPAs.

The women’s rowing program led the spring sports with 52 honorees while men’s lacrosse had 35, fencing had 25, women’s lacrosse and women’s track & field each had 24 and baseball had 21.

The complete list of Ohio State’s spring and at-large Academic All-Big Ten selections is available via PDF at the link above or in the table below.
